body:
### Problem

The v0.11.5 nvim-linux-arm64.appimage in the releases is not an Aarch64 binary, but actually an ARMv5 (EABI5), often colloquially referred to as `arm32`. This is not executable on my Linux VM on Apple Silicon:

```
$ ./nvim-linux-arm64.appimage --version
-bash: ./nvim-linux-arm64.appimage: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error
``` 

The previous release, v0.11.4, works just fine though:


```
$ vagrant@dbfvm:~/.local/appimages/arm64  11:07:58
# ./nvim-linux-arm64.appimage --version
NVIM v0.11.4
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.1741730670
Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info
```

Please can the release process revert to producing AArch64 binaries?

Interesting to note that the usual binfmt_misc trick to run Linux binaries intended for other CPU architectures doesn't seem to work on these binaries:

```
# vagrant@dbfvm:~/.local/appimages/arm64  11:14:05
# uname -mo
aarch64 GNU/Linux

vagrant@dbfvm:~/.local/appimages/arm64  11:15:48
# docker run --privileged --rm tonistiigi/binfmt --install all
{
  "supported": [
    "linux/arm64",
    "linux/amd64",
    "linux/amd64/v2",
    "linux/riscv64",
    "linux/ppc64le",
    "linux/s390x",
    "linux/386",
    "linux/mips64le",
    "linux/mips64",
    "linux/loong64",
    "linux/arm/v7",
    "linux/arm/v6"
  ],
  "emulators": [
    "python3.12",
    "qemu-arm",
    "qemu-i386",
    "qemu-loongarch64",
    "qemu-mips64",
    "qemu-mips64el",
    "qemu-ppc64le",
    "qemu-riscv64",
    "qemu-s390x",
    "qemu-x86_64"
  ]
}


# vagrant@dbfvm:~/.local/appimages/arm64  11:14:09
# ls -1 /proc/sys/fs/binfmt_misc
python3.12
qemu-arm
qemu-i386
qemu-loongarch64
qemu-mips64
qemu-mips64el
qemu-ppc64le
qemu-riscv64
qemu-s390x
qemu-x86_64
register
status


# vagrant@dbfvm:~/.local/appimages/arm64  11:16:38
# ./nvim-linux-arm64.appimage.0.11.5 --version
-bash: ./nvim-linux-arm64.appimage.0.11.5: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error

```

### Steps to reproduce

```
# vagrant@dbfvm:~/.local/appimages/arm64
# uname -a
Linux dbfvm 6.8.0-71-generic #71-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Tue Jul 22 16:44:45 UTC 2025 aarch64 aarch64 aarch64 GNU/Linux


# vagrant@dbfvm:~/.local/appimages/arm64
# wget -q https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/download/v0.11.5/nvim-linux-arm64.appimage


# vagrant@dbfvm:~/.local/appimages/arm64
# file nvim-linux-arm64.appimage
nvim-linux-arm64.appimage: ELF 32-bit LSB pie executable, ARM, EABI5 version 1 (SYSV), static-pie linked, BuildID[sha1]=1a9abc749122c8bb76290e5e39fb5f1a3014458b, stripped


# vagrant@dbfvm:~/.local/appimages/arm64
# chmod 0755 nvim-linux-arm64.appimage


# vagrant@dbfvm:~/.local/appimages/arm64
# ./nvim-linux-arm64.appimage
-bash: ./nvim-linux-arm64.appimage: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error
``` 

### Expected behavior

The previous release, v0.11.4, works just fine though:


```
# vagrant@dbfvm:~/.local/appimages/arm64
# ls   # Show starting condition is an empty dir


# vagrant@dbfvm:~/.local/appimages/arm64
# wget -q https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/download/v0.11.4/nvim-linux-arm64.appimage


# vagrant@dbfvm:~/.local/appimages/arm64
# file nvim-linux-arm64.appimage
nvim-linux-arm64.appimage: ELF 64-bit LSB pie executable, ARM aarch64, version 1 (SYSV), static-pie linked, BuildID[sha1]=8b1028122120dc38a9b51955cb51306a870c2b5f, stripped


# vagrant@dbfvm:~/.local/appimages/arm64
# chmod 0755 nvim-linux-arm64.appimage


# vagrant@dbfvm:~/.local/appimages/arm64
# ./nvim-linux-arm64.appimage --version
NVIM v0.11.4
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.1741730670
Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info
```

Please can the release process revert to producing AArch64 binaries?

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

v0.11.5

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

n/a

### Operating system/version

Linux on Apple Silicon (aarch64 GNU/Linux)

### Terminal name/version

tmux 3.5a + kitty 0.45.0

### $TERM environment variable

tmux-256color

### Installation

github appimage, nvim-linux-arm64.appimage

labels.description: packaging and distributing Nvim to users
labels.name: distribution

title: v0.11.5 nvim-linux-arm64.appimage: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error
